title: What Is an Exposure Assessment in Industrial Hygiene?
summary: Understand exposure assessments, why they matter, and how they protect workers in hazardous environments.

sections.heading: What Is an Exposure Assessment?
body: An exposure assessment evaluates the level of worker exposure to hazardous substances or conditions during job tasks.
Industrial hygienists use exposure assessments to determine risks and select appropriate controls.

sections.heading: Why Exposure Assessments Matter
body: They protect worker health, support OSHA compliance, and guide engineering and administrative controls.
Accurate exposure data prevents both under-protection and unnecessary PPE requirements.

sections.heading: How Exposure Assessments Are Conducted
body: Assessments include task observation, air monitoring, review of materials, and comparison to regulatory limits.
Results guide safety decisions and documentation.

faqs.question: Who performs exposure assessments?
faqs.answer: Typically industrial hygienists or trained EHS professionals.
